questions.question_text: The NIST Information Security and Privacy Advisory Board (ISPAB) paper "Perspectives on Cloud Computing and Standards" specifies potential advantages and disdvantages of virtualization. Which of the following disadvantages does it include? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. Choose all that apply.

choices.A: It increases capabilities for fault tolerant computing using rollback and snapshot features.
choices.D: It increases overall security risk shared resources.
choices.E: It creates the possibility that remote attestation may not work.
choices.B: It increases intrusion detection through introspection.
choices.C: It initiates the risk that malicious software is targeting the VM environment.
choices.G: It increases configuration effort because of complexity and composite system.
choices.F: It involves new protection mechanisms for preventing VM escape, VM detection, and VM-VM interference.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDEFG
The possible disadvantages of virtualization included in the NIST ISPAB paper are:

C. It initiates the risk that malicious software is targeting the VM environment.

D. It increases overall security risk shared resources.

E. It creates the possibility that remote attestation may not work.

F. It involves new protection mechanisms for preventing VM escape, VM detection, and VM-VM interference.

G. It increases configuration effort because of complexity and composite system.

The correct answers are: C, D, E, F, G.

Selected Answer: CDEFG
Correct Answer: CDEFG

VM detection, and VM-VM interference. It initiates the possibility of virtual networking configuration errors. questions.question_text: Which of the following are the types of access controls? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. Choose three.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABDE
The correct answers are:

A. Initiate IA implementation plan
B. Develop DIACAP strategy
D. Assemble DIACAP team
E. Register system with DoD Component IA Program.

These are the subordinate tasks of the Initiate and Plan IA C&A phase of the DIACAP process. Assigning IA controls and conducting validation activity are part of later phases in the process (Implement and Validate), not the initial planning phase.

comments.content:
"IA" stands for Information Assurance, "C&A" stands for Certification and Accreditation, and "DIACAP" is an acronym for Defense Information Assurance Certification and Accreditation Process. Therefore, the full expansion of "Initiate and Plan IA C&A phase of the DIACAP" would be:

The stage in the process where information assurance activities are initiated to certify that a defense information system meets security standards set by DoD along with developing plans to achieve accreditation. These activities include associated procedures like defining architecture baseline initiatives, controlling access points of vulnerabilities or potential threats during system lifecycle acquisition design; confirming necessary IT infrastructure requirements needed as dictated through consistently updated Compliance Risk Management (CRM) measures which adhere guidelines established in National Institute Standards Technology (NIST).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A sabotage attack is a deliberate action aimed at disrupting, damaging or destroying computer systems, networks, and infrastructure. In the context of software security, sabotaging an application involves injecting malicious code into its source code or corrupting its data to impair its proper functioning. Sabotage attacks can lead to loss of critical data, downtime of essential services and applications which leads to business disruption and financial losses. It can also impact the reputation of an organization that relies on technology for operation if such incidents result in breach of confidentiality or integrity violations.
